title: Crime Festers in Republican States While Their Troops Patrol Washington
summary: Republican governors who have mustered National Guard troops for deployment in blue-state cities may re-examine their deployments if federal intervention significantly brings crime down.

title: Xi, Putin and Modi Try to Signal Unity at China Summit
summary: Their display of friendship in China was aimed at projecting an alternative to U.S. global leadership, even as serious differences among them remain.

title: India Was the Economic Alternative to China. Trump Ended That.
summary: A lurch in policy has shaken the India-U.S. economic alliance against China, leaving India little choice but to consider reversing its own strategy.

title: Afghanistan Earthquake Leaves More Than 800 Dead
summary: The quake, near the border with Pakistan, injured more than 2,500 people in mountainous areas that rescue workers took hours to reach.

summary: Hundreds of people were killed and more than 2,500 were injured, according to the Taliban government, and the death toll was expected to rise.

title: Trump’s Push to Punish Flag Burning Puts Landmark Free Speech Ruling at Risk
summary: The Supreme Court ruled in 1989 that burning an American flag is speech protected by the First Amendment. President Trump says it should be punished.

summary: As the sun sets on another summer, John Hersh is wrapping up his 10th year of rooftop serenades.

summary: A shift toward pressing for a permanent cease-fire deal, alongside plans for a new offensive in Gaza City, means the fighting is unlikely to end soon.

summary: The Bulgarian authorities believe that Russia disrupted navigation signals that would have been used by a plane carrying Ursula von der Leyen, European officials said.

title: Ukraine War Leads to Global Shortage of TNT for Military and Mining Use
summary: Mining materials to make cement, gravel and a host of other common products require an explosive that is becoming more expensive and limited in supply.

summary: Ukraine said it had arrested a suspect in the murder of the politician, who had voiced anti-Russian views. The authorities did not explain how the suspect was tied to Moscow.

title: Dan Rather Is Still Chasing the News
summary: He’s 93, and 20 years removed from signing off as a CBS anchor. But he’s still tapping out stories. “As Popeye used to say, I am what I am.”

summary: The oil giant accused the state’s attorney general and four nonprofit groups of defamation after they sued over recycling claims.

summary: We study photographers’ contact sheets from the last century.

title: In the Remains of Canada’s Jasper Wildfire, Clues to Tame Future Blazes
summary: A giant fire last year consumed much of Canada’s Jasper National Park. Canadian scientists leading research into wildfires are using the blaze to learn lessons for the future.

summary: The artist Fonki developed a graffiti style that blends ancient motifs with scenes of modern Cambodia.
